intro: Castilleja martini subsp. ewanii, commonly known as the Ewan's paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its bright red to orange tubular flowers. The plant has reduced leaves and relies on host plants for some of its nutrients, making it a partial parasite. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its unique floral structure and ecological role make it an important species in its native ecosystems.
